title: Lucifer season 5 confirmed to split in two by Tom Ellis
text:
Tom Ellis confirmed season 5 will be split in two (Picture: FOX Image Collection via Getty Images)

Lucifer’s Tom Ellis has confirmed that Lucifer’s fifth and final season will be split in two parts – essentially giving fans the season six they were gagging for.

Superfan Kelly Clarkson took viewers on a set tour of the Netflix series for her TV show, bringing along her mum and sister in order to meet the entire cast.

(They even managed to hop into Lucifer’s bedroom for a cheeky snap with Tom…the devils.)

In the clip, which was aired on Kelly’s show on Monday night, Tom confirmed that season five, which is currently in production, will be split into two halves.

He told her: ‘Netflix is going to drop eight episodes, and then there’s going to be a little break, and then they’re going to drop another eight episodes.’

The news is sure to delight fans who demanded an extra season when it was revealed that the show would be ending at the close of its next run.

Due to demand, the show was extended from a 10-episode order to 16 episodes, and now that’s being divided to a part one and part two.

So while fans might not *technically* be getting a season six, we can consider this one a win, folks.

The upcoming episodes are due to be full-on fan service with one of the installments confirmed as an an all-singing, all-dancing musical.

Though no one is clearly more excited than Kelly Clarkson’s mum, who couldn’t help but shriek with excitement at getting a hug from Tom or the rest of the cast, there is more to get hyped about.

The Lucifer cast have all admitted they weren’t ready for the show to end (Picture: Instagram)

Lucifer’s writing team have been dropping hints about what’s to come with the title reveal of one episode at a time, presumably as they start recording it.

Currently, they’re on episode six – which means the first half is nearly done.

While there’s currently no confirmed release date, are we about to see the beloved Netflix show return sooner rather than later?
